properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL Round 9: St George-Illawarra Dragons v Bulldogs. Kick-off is at approx 4 pm on Sunday 30 April.


﻿A road closure on Harbour Street from Crown Street to Stewart Street will be implemented to allow safe pedestrian access.


Traffic may be heavier than usual on Burelli St, Corrimal St, Stewart St and Crown St as fans travel to and from the game.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Harbour Street from Crown Street to Stewart Street

properties.publicTransport: Buses run regularly to Rosehill Gardens from Parramatta Interchange. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Caravan Camping Supershow at Rosehill Gardens will be held from Tuesday 18 to Sunday 23 April from 9:30am to 5pm from Tuesday to Saturday and from 9:30am to 4pm on Sunday.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on James Ruse Drive and Hassall Street before and after the event each day, particularly over the weekend.

On-site parking will be in high demand as is expected to fill. Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity around the racecourse.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am to 5pm daily from Thursday 13 to Monday 17 April on Grand Avenue from 100m prior to Gate 1 Australian Turf Club Rosehill Gardens to opposite Grand Avenue North (southern side).

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and also apply to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed call 132 701 to find its new location.

properties.publicTransport: Shuttle buses will run from local areas. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Ramadan Night markets on Haldon St from Tue 21 Mar to Thu 20 Apr from 5pm to 3am nightly.

Heavy traffic is expected in the area, particularly on Thursday – Sunday nights during the festival.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra time as roads will be closed around Lakemba Station and detours will be in place.

The following road closures will be in place from 4pm to 3am each night from Tue 21 Mar to Thu 20 Apr:

  • Haldon St between Railway Pde and The Boulevarde
  • Haldon St between 178 Haldon St and Grace Ave
  • The Boulevarde between Croydon St and Oneata Ln
  • The Boulevarde between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Gillies St between Quigg St and Haldon St
  • Oneata St between Croydon St Haldon St

Follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police on site.
properties.diversions:
Southbound traffic on Haldon St north of the railway line will be detoured using Railway Pde, Moreton St, The Blvd, Quigg St, Grace Ave and Haldon St to Canterbury Rd.

Northbound traffic on Haldon St will be detoured using Grace Ave, Quigg St, The Blvd and Moreton St to Lakemba St.

Eastbound traffic on The Blvd west of Haldon St will be detoured using Croydon St to Canterbury Rd.

Westbound traffic on The Blvd east of Haldon St will be detoured using Quigg St, Grace Ave andHaldon St to Canterbury Rd.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Multiple concerts will be held at Qudos Bank Arena in Olympic Park during the Sydney Royal Easter show including:

  • Sat 15 April - JJ Lin at Qudos Bank Arena from 7.30pm
  • Sun 16 April – The 1975 concert at Qudos Bank Arena from 7pm

Traffic will be heavier than usual while thousands of people attend the Easter Show so allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

Roads are closed within Sydney Olympic Park from Thursday 23 March until Wednesday 26 April 2023 before, during and after the Sydney Royal Easter Show. Check out the interactive map or Easter Show closure listing for more details. 

Fans are urged to pre-book their parking online, available until 11:59pm the night before the event. Parking will be in high demand and is likely to sell out in advance.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.publicTransport: Light rail and buses run regularly to Moore Park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Family Show will be held at The Entertainment Quarter from Thursday 6 to Sunday 23 April from 10am to 5pm daily, except 6 April 10am to 3pm.

Traffic is expected to be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St and Lang Rd approaching Moore Park as families travel to and from the Show each day.

The precinct will be particularly busy while events are held at neighbouring Allianz Stadium, Sydney Cricket Ground and Hordern Pavilion so allow plenty of extra travel time as parking will be in demand on these days.

﻿Motorists should allow extra travel time in the area and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in and around Moore Park on game days during the Show including Saturday 8, Saturday 15 and Sunday 16 April so check signs carefully before parking as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.publicTransport: Buses may experience delays through Mascot while closures are in place. Visit transportnsw.info for service disruption information.
properties.otherAdvice:
Pre-Anzac Day commemorations will be held at Mascot with a march along King St from 2:15pm, finishing at Mascot Memorial Park by 2:45pm.

For the safety of the marchers, NSW Police will implement rolling road closures along Botany Rd northbound lanes from King St to Coward St from 2:15pm to 2:45pm. Sections of King St, MacIntosh St, Forster St and Coward St will also close and there will be no access to Botany Rd northbound during this time. 

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in place effect from 12.30pm to 4pm on Sunday 23 April at the following locations.

  • Botany Rd between King St and Coward St (western side/northbound)
  • Coward St between Botany Rd and Henry Kendall Crescent (both sides)
  • King St between Botany Rd and 230 King Street (both sides)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sharks v Roosters at PointsBet Stadium in Woolooware. Kick-off from 6pm and full-time around 8pm. 

Road closures will be in place on Captain Cook Drive from approximately 10 minutes before kick off and remain in place until crowds have cleared after full-time.

Traffic on roads approaching the stadium may be heavier than usual on Friday evening including Captain Cook Dr, Woolooware Rd and Gannons Rd. 

Motorists in the area should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Sea Eagles v Storm at 4 Pines Park in Brookvale. Kick off from 8pm, full-time around 10pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pittwater Rd, Old Pittwater Rd, Warringah Rd and Beacon Hill Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium on Friday evening.

Fans driving to the game should allow extra travel time as parking will be in high demand and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Newcastle Jets v Macarthur FC at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off at 7:45pm and full-time around 9pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Melbourne City. Game starts at 5pm, finish around 7pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium including Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to and from the game.

Dane Dr will be closed between the Central Coast Hwy and Donnison St before the match and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

properties.publicTransport: Routes 549, 550, 600, 601 and 606 will be diverting and using different stops while the road closures are in place at the end of the game. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Eels v Bulldogs at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 4:05pm, finish around 5:35pm.

Heavy traffic is expected on roads approaching and within Parramatta as fans travel to the game during the busy Thursday evening peak.

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd.

Roads outside the stadium will close from 5.45pm to 6.15pm approximately to allow crowds to safely leave the venue. Roads will re-open once crowds have cleared the area. 

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Fans should follow the directions of traffic controllers and NSW Police and allow extra time when exiting car parks. If you’re travelling home by taxi or ride share choose a pick up location away from the stadium to avoid traffic delays.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on trains is included in event tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Melbourne Victory at CommBank Stadium. Kick off from 7:45pm, finish around 9:40pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Parramatta CBD including O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd and James Ruse Dr as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. Note, traffic changes for Parramatta Light Rail may affect how you travel through Parramatta CBD.

properties.publicTransport: Event tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
All Aged Stakes Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 11:20am, last race at 4:45pm and concert from 5:10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as event goers travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Panthers at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off at 5:30pm and full-time around 7:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in event tickets. Light rail services and buses run frequently to Moore Park so leave the car at home. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

properties.otherAdvice:
Super Rugby Waratahs v Western Force at Allianz Stadium. Gates open 6:30pm, kick-off from 7:30pm and full time around 9:10pm

Traffic may be heavier than usual on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd as fans travel to and from the game during the Friday evening peak.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 5:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 Car park will be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to 11pm on sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Double Header at Allianz Stadium. Men: Sydney FC v Perth Glory, kick-off from 3pm and full-time around 4:45pm. Women's Semi Final: Sydney FC v Western United FC, kick-off from 5:45pm and full time around 7:30pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual as fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 1pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game. No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd, from the Eastern Distributor use the Randwick exit. EP2 Car park will be closed.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 1pm until 6pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

webLinks.linkText: Randwick City Council - Coogee Anzac Day

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 313, 350, 370, 373 and 374 will be diverting while roads are closed. For more details check travel alerts at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads in Coogee will be closed for Anzac Day Commemorations. 

From 5am to 7am the following roads will close for the Dawn Service:

  • Arden St from Dolphin Street to Carr St
  • Coogee Bay Rd from Brook St to Arden St
  • Alfreda St at Arden St
  • Vicar St to Coogee Bay Rd

The Dolphin Street car park (near Coogee Pavilion) will be closed for the event from 5pm Monday 24 April to 7:30am Tuesday 25 April.

Motorists can detour around the closures via local roads. Allow extra travel time and follow the direction of traffic controllers onsite.

roads.mainStreet: Arden Street, Coogee Bay Road, Alfreda Street, Vicar Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place for an Anzac Day Dawn Service held outside the Brighton Le Sands RSL Club.

Bay St will be closed in both directions between The Grand Parade and Moate Ave from 5:15am to approximately 7am.

Motorists should follow the directions of traffic controllers on-site and can detour around the closure via local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of music fans are expected to attend the annual Byron Bay Bluesfest at Bryon Bay Events Farm, just north of Byron Bay over the Easter Long Weekend from Thursday 6 until Monday 10 April.

Traffic may be heavier than usual from Wednesday 5 April on the M1 Pacific Motorway at Tyagarah, and Ewingsdale Rd and Gulgan Rd interchanges on approach to the event.

Local roads around Tyagarah may also be busy. 

Motorists should exercise caution and follow the direction of traffic controllers and signage along the motorway directing motorists to the festival site. 

Motorists travelling to Bluesfest or travelling in the area over the Easter long weekend should Allow extra travel time and expect delays in the area throughout the weekend. Consider alternate routes or travelling outside the peak crowd arrival/departure times to avoid some of the delays.

properties.publicTransport: Route buses 333 and 380 will be diverting and missing stops while roads are closed. For more details check travel alerts at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads in North Bondi will be closed for an Anzac Day Dawn Service.

From 4am to 7am approximately, Campbell Pde will be closed between Queen Elizabeth Dr and Brighton Blvd.

Motorists will be detoured via local roads. Allow extra travel time and follow the direction of traffic controllers onsite.

webLinks.linkText: RSL NSW - Anzac Day Sydney CBD
NSW Gov - Anzac Day in NSW

properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is free on Anzac Day and additional early morning services will run. Buses will be diverting while roads are closed and Light rail services will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall until 6am during the Dawn Service. Visit transportnsw.info for details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Major roads will be closed in the Sydney CBD for the Anzac Day Dawn Service in Martin Place from 4:20am and March on Elizabeth St from 9am. 

Motorists should avoid travelling through the CBD while roads are closed or expect delays and allow extra travel time. While roads are closed travel east/west across the CBD is maintained via Bridge St or via Goulburn St.

Key road closures:

  • From 2am to 4pm: Pitt St, George St and Castlereagh St between Hunter and King Streets. Local streets will also be closed including Hosking Pl, De Mestre Pl and Wynyard Ln.
  • From 2am to 6pm: Angel Pl and Ash St.
  • From 6am to 4pm: Major roads between Bridge St in Circular Quay and Goulburn St in the CBD South including sections of Castlereagh St, Elizabeth St, King St, Market St, Margaret St, Hunter St, O’Connell St, Gresham St, Bent St, Park St, Bathurst St, Bond St, Bligh St, Phillip St, Loftus St and Liverpool St.

There will be no managed vehicle access or access to/from driveways within the road closure footprint for the safety of participants and spectators. Pedestrians can cross the march route at the designated crossing point on Elizabeth St at Park St, Bathurst St and at Museum Station.

Cycleway closures will be in place on Pitt St from 2am to 4pm and sections of King, Liverpool, Park, Pitt and Phillip Streets from 6am to 4pm.

Extensive special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on various major roads in the Sydney CBD from 1am around Martin Place and from 5.30am until 4pm on other major roads.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents, businesses or TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies so check signs carefully on the day and the night before as clearways come into effect in the early morning. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in NRL match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL matches will be held at Accor Stadium in Olympic Park on the long weekend during the Sydney Royal Easter show including:

  • Fri 7 April - NRL: Bulldogs v Rabbitohs at Accor Stadium from 4pm to 5.45pm
  • Mon 10 April – NRL: Wests Tigers v Eels at Accor Stadium from 4pm to 5.45pm

Allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd, particularly on Good Friday and Easter Monday where the Show typically sees its largest crowds.

CAR PARK UPDATE: All car parks in Olympic Park have sold out for Good Friday 7 April and Easter Monday 10 April. If you haven't pre-booked you'll need to catch public transport as there will be no parking available on site. Travel on transport is included in your match ticket. Consider parking at a nearby station commuter carpark and continuing your trip by train or bus to Olympic Park. If you have pre-booked follow directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

Roads are closed within Sydney Olympic Park from Thursday 23 March until Wednesday 26 April 2023 before, during and after the Sydney Royal Easter Show. Check out the interactive map or Easter Show closure listing for more details.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road, Centenary Drive

properties.otherAdvice:
The Greek and Macedonian Easter Procession will take place on Friday 14 April 2023 from 8pm to 10pm.


The procession will occupy Stewart, Harbour and Burelli Street.


Corrrimal Street from Burelli Street to Stewart Street will be closed and a detour will be in place. Motorists will be detoured via Burelli Street, Kembla Street and Stewart Street.

Bjorn Again will be performing at the Sid Kallas oval in Cowra on Friday 14 April as part of their "Thank Abba for the Music 2023 Tour". Motorists are reminded to be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.
properties.displayName: Bjorn Again - Thank ABBA for the Music 2023 Tour

webLinks.linkText: Sydney Fish Market Easter Trading info

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Fish Market extended Easter Trading Hours will take place on Good Friday of the Easter Long Weekend. Retailers will be open from 5am-5pm on Good Friday 7 April. Business will continue as usual over the remainder of the long weekend, with retailers open from 7am-4pm daily 8 to 10 April.

Delays are expected on the Western Distributor approaching the Pyrmont and Glebe off-ramps as well as on local roads in the area. Motorists are advised to allow plenty of extra travel time.

Limited parking is available on-site at the Sydney Fish Market car park and will be in high demand.

Additional parking will be available nearby on Good Friday only at the Sydney Secondary College, entry via Pyrmont Bridge Rd.

Motorists should follow the direction of traffic controllers, when car parks reach capacity motorists will be redirected.

Pedestrian access to the markets will be via the corner of Bank St and Pyrmont Bridge Rd, Pyrmont Bridge Rd near Wattle St and opposite the Fish Market Light Rail stop on Bank St.

roads.mainStreet: Pyrmont Bridge Road and Bridge Road

webLinks.linkText: Maules Creek Coal Mine Community Open Day

properties.otherAdvice: The Whitehaven Coal Maules Creek Mine Community Open Day will be held on Saturday 15 April between 8:30am to 4:00pm. There will be reduced speeds of 40 km/h and 60 km/h as well as traffic control in place during the event. Motorists are reminded to allow extra travel time and follow the direction of signs and traffic controllers.
properties.displayName: Maules Creek Coal Mine Community Open Day

properties.otherAdvice: The Canowindra International Balloon Challenge will be taking place in Canowindra from Wednesday 12 April until Sunday 16 April. On Saturday 15 April from 2pm until 10pm the speed limit on Canowindra Road (Rodd Street) between Thompson Street and Longs Corner Road will be reduced to 40km/h and will be under traffic control. Motorists in the area should allow extra time, follow the directions of traffic control on site and be aware of increased pedestrian activity in the area.
properties.displayName: Canowindra Balloon Festival - Cabonne Community Glow

properties.otherAdvice:
Boorowa St between Main St and Clarke St will be closed between 9am and 2pm for the Pontiac Car Parade and Show and Shine.

Motorists should detour via Main St, Cloete St and Zouch St.

The annual Burrawang Easter Market will take place on Saturday 8 April between 8 am and 3 pm.

A speed reduction of 60 km/h will be in place on the Illawarra Highway.

Local closures and detours will also be in place.

properties.publicTransport: Race day tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Championship Day 2 at Royal Randwick Racecourse. First race from 11:35am, last race at 5:10pm and concert from 5:20pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to and from the races.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads around the racecourse at the following times and locations:

  • 4am – 7pm: Darley Road between Alison Road and Centennial Park round-a-bout (western side)
  • 8am – 7pm: Ascot Street between Doncaster Avenue and Randwick Racecourse Ascot Street entry (both sides)
  • 3pm – 7pm: High Street between UNSW Gate 2 and Anzac Parade (southern side)

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Panthers v Sea Eagles at BlueBet Stadium. Kick-off from 5:30pm and full-time approx. 7:15pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Mulgoa Rd, Jamison Rd and Jane St/Great Western Hwy through Penrith as fans travel to the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Macarthur FC v Western Sydney Wanderers at Campbelltown Sports Stadium. Start from 7:45pm, finish approx 9:10pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on Pembroke Rd, Rose Payten Dr and Leumeah Rd as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Pembroke Road and Rose Payten Drive

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in match tickets. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
AFL: Swans v Port Adelaide at SCG. First bounce from 7:30pm and full-time around 10:10pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual as thousands of fans travel to the stadium. Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and around Moore Park including the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Fans travelling from the north are reminded that lane closures will be in place southbound on the Harbour Bridge over the Easter long weekend for roadwork. Allow extra time as delays are expected southbound on the Warringah Fwy on approach to the Harbour Tunnel.

Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 4:30pm and will reopen once crowds have safely cleared the area after the game.

No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP2 Kippax car park will be maintained via Moore Park Rd and access to EP3 grass car park and drop off areas maintained from Lang Rd.

Special event clearways will be in effect on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm until 11pm including sections of Lang Rd, Fitzroy St, Moore Park Rd, Albion St, Cleveland St, Flinders St and Foveaux St.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

SURRY HILLS / MOORE PARK - 3PM TO 11PM

  • Albion Street between Bourke Street and Flinders Street (both sides)
  • Cleveland Street between South Dowling Street and City Road (both sides)
  • Flinders Street between Albion Street and Moore Park Road (eastern side)
  • Fitzroy Street between South Dowling Street and Bourke Street (northern side)
  • Foveaux Street between Bourke Street and Crown Street (northern side)
  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Driver Avenue and Anzac Parade (southern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Greens Road (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Cook Road and Poate Road (southern side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

roads.mainStreet: Moore Park Road, Anzac Parade, Lang Road, Eastern Distributor

properties.publicTransport:
Berry Train station is located close to the event site. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

Shuttle buses will run to the showground from Kiama, Gerringong, Gerroa, and Nowra. More details at the event website.
properties.otherAdvice:
Lazy Mountain festival will take place on April 8 (Easter Saturday) at Berry Showground from midday. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual along the Princes Hwy approaching the off-ramp to Queen St, Kangaroo Valley Rd, Coolangatta Rd and other local roads in Berry as crowds arrive and leave the event.

Lawrence Hargrave Drive will have a 60km/h speed reduction from the Princes Hwy to Stonehaven Rd.

Southbound motorists on Lawrence Hargrave Drive can expect intermittent detours via Princes Hwy, Parkes St and Walker St to minimise queuing on the motorway.

Take extra care when driving through the area as there will be a high pedestrian movement.

Traffic controllers will be on site to direct motorists.
properties.diversions:
Southbound on Walker Street: Use Lawrence Hargrave Drive

Northbound on Walker Street: Use Walker Street, Parkes Street, Princes Highway and Lawrence Hargrave Drive.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on public transport is included in tickets to the Show. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run daily. Regular route buses 525, 526 and N81 in Olympic Park will use different stops while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Hundreds of thousands of people are expected to visit the annual Sydney Royal Easter Show over 12 days at Sydney Olympic Park from Thursday 6 April until Monday 17 April. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching the precinct including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd throughout the show, particularly over the Easter Long Weekend. 

It is essential to pre-book parking online for those driving to the event (available until 11.59pm the night before, unless sold out prior) to secure a space as parking will fill early or sell out in advance.

Road closures and changes to parklands will be in place within the Sydney Olympic Park Precinct from Thursday 23 March until Wednesday 26 April 2023 before, during and after the Easter Show including sections of Dawn Fraser Ave, Olympic Blvd, Showground Rd, Murray Rose Ave, Kevin Coombs Ave, Marjorie Jackson Pwy, Shirley Strickland Ave, Rod Laver Dr. Check out the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map or Easter Show closure listing for more details.

CAR PARK UPDATE: All car parks in Olympic Park have sold out for Easter Sunday 9 April and Easter Monday 10 April. 

If you haven't pre-booked you'll need to catch public transport as there will be no parking available on site. Travel on transport is included in your event ticket. Consider parking at a nearby station commuter carpark and continuing your trip by train or bus to Olympic Park. If you have pre-booked follow directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Dr, Epping Rd, Lane Cove Rd

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NRL: Knights v Warriors at McDonald Jones Stadium. Kick-off at 6:15pm and full-time around 8:15pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as fans travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

The Blessing of the Fleet will take place on Sun 9 Apr between 8am and 7pm on the Princes Hwy between North St and Deering St.

Motorists are advised to exercise caution in the area with an expected increase in pedestrian activity.
properties.diversions: Deering St and Vincent St in both directions.

properties.otherAdvice:
The Grand Parade is a part of the Land Rover 75th Anniversary celebrations being held in Cooma over the Easter long weekend.

Detours will be in place from 8.30am to 12.30pm.

The parade will comprise of about 700 Land Rover vehicles which include Land Rover enthusiasts from all over the State.
properties.diversions:
Light vehicles: Lambie St, Vulcan St, Barrock St, Amost St, Massie St and Bradley St.

Heavy vehicles: Boundary St, Commissioner St and Hilton St.
